results.title: Who's got a right to Rhodesia?

results.brief_description: A documentary about the racial conflict in Rhodesia. Includes interviews with leaders of both sides and raises the question of United States involvement.

results.title: Aids to independence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
Outlines how elderly people can be assisted to live independently and the contribution of voluntary agencies in providing meeting places. Lord Morrison of Lambeth, a pioneer of municipal government discusses the role of the community and the program concludes with an extract from an interview with the famous psychoanalyst Professor Carl Jung when he was 85.

results.title: The Magic of animation
results.creator_credit: Rick Butler, Good Day Productions and Ontario Educational Communications Authority
results.brief_description: A look at the people and techniques involved in the production of animated films. Includes interviews with animators from the United States, Canada, France, Holland, Poland and Yugoslavia intercut with excerpts of some of their works. Written and narrated by Rick Butler, Camera by Richard Stringer, edited by David Maltby, sound by John Uhtoff and title design by Vergo.

results.title: Water skiing
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines basic courtesies and safety rules and procedures of the sport. Cast includes Bronwyn Wright, Robbie Woods. Commentary by Ken Warby.

results.title: Means of being rescued
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the importance of storing safety equipment on small craft, of being prepared for an emergency, and the correct distress procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, Patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer. Credits: Producer, Peter Johnson; director, script, Rob McAuley; photographer, Peter Hopwood; editor, Max Lemon; sound, Harry Haws; commentator, Ken Warby.

results.title: Seamanship
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the three main factors that constitute good seamanship knowledge of the boat, one’s own limitations and correct weight distribution. Commentatory by Ken Warby. Cast includes Allan Robertson, Paul Coolahan, John Kelly, Barry Duncan.

results.title: The Blue angel (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Erich Pommer and UFA
results.brief_description: The infatuation of a professor for a nightclub singer leads to his downfall. Sternberg reversed the meaning of Heinrich Mann’s novel “Professor Unrath” by making the professor a foolish, repressed victim rather than the corrupt and hypocritical exploiter of Lola portrayed in the novel. The film already shows Sternberg’s interest in visual density rather than narrative vigour, creating atmosphere rather than narrative tension, a preference for the maximum expressiveness of decor and lighting over surface realism. Stars Marlene Dietrich, Emil Jannings, Hans Albers and Kurt Gerron. Note: German dialogue, English subtitles.

The film already shows Sternberg’s interest in visual density rather than narrative vigour, creating atmosphere rather than narrative tension, a preference for the maximum expressiveness of decor and lighting over surface realism. Stars Marlene Dietrich, Emil Jannings, Hans Albers and Kurt Gerron. Note: German dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.
results.description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.

results.title: The Road to interdependence
results.creator_credit: Paul Auerswald, Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
A commentary by the U.S. Department of State, on United States foreign relations since the second World War, using original film clippings. It emphasises the role of the United States in such events as the Cold War, Vietnam and the Middle East Crisis.

results.title: The Last taboos
results.creator_credit: Dale McCulley, Ginger Blackwell and Cavalcade Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary dealing with the effects of childhood sexual abuse and is not intended as a study or demonstration of counselling techniques shown - the subject matter is emotionally charged and maybe disturbing. Group counselling American style, it encourages victims to talk about their experiences and to act out their anger, with good results.
